elements.title: Arthur Dudley Dobson Memorial (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Arthur Dudley Dobson Memorial (pictured) was unveiled by New Zealand's prime minister George Forbes on this day 85 years ago?

elements.title: Hugh Gaine (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that during the American Revolution, Hugh Gaine's printing shop was threatened by the Sons of Liberty because of his wavering loyalty to the American cause?

elements.title: The Problems of Genocide (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that historian Dirk Moses argues that The Problems of Genocide include "blinding us to other types of humanly caused civilian death"?

elements.title: Katharina Konradi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Katharina Konradi, a soprano born in Kyrgyzstan, made a recording of lieder with pianist Gerold Huber including settings by Lori Laitman of children's poems written in Terezin?

elements.title: Sanrūmu Nite (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that manga artist Keiko Takemiya intentionally submitted her manga series Sanrūmu Nite immediately before its publication deadline to avoid it being edited?

elements.title: Marika Sila (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Inuvialuk actress Marika Sila views her acting career as a platform for outreach and education on the culture and rights of Indigenous peoples in Canada?

elements.title: Abadi (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Abadi was banned twice: by Sukarno in 1960, then by Suharto in 1974?

elements.title: Beaversprite (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that at Beaversprite, beavers lived indoors and were allowed to chew on the furniture?
